newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Average prices down, volume up on Bucharest bourse.
newsitem.headline: Average prices down, volume up on Bucharest bourse.

text.p: The Bucharest bourse saw most average prices slide on Friday as investors held on to their wait-and-see mood.
Two unofficial indices, the VAB and the BIG, dropped by 6.5 and 3.51 percent respectively from the previous session. The BIG first-tier index was 4.66 percent down at 2,897.67 points.
"Investors still consider prices too high, their waiting mood will stay on part of next week, too," said a trader.
Volumes rose to 2.3 million shares from 1.9 million and turnover went up by some 700 million lei to 7.1 billion.
The rise in volume and turnover levels was mainly a result of two special trades in first-tier Oltchim chemical plant and Policolor PLCR.BX dye maker, a second-tier listing.

Oltchim had a special trade -- a deal struck outside the market and reported to the exchange later -- involving 200,000 shares worth a total 480 million lei. The Policolor deal was worth 280 million lei from trading in 50,000 shares.
The two deals helped the stocks close higher. Oltchim ended 50 lei up at 2,400 and Policolor firmed 100 lei to 5,600.
The first tier, which lists three more companies besides Oltchim, led the market, with around 75 percent of turnover.
First-tier Azomures fertiliser maker and pharmaceuticals company Antibiotice ATBE.BX lost on their average prices and also closed 150 lei and 100 lei weaker at 2,500 and 4,800.
Terapia pharmaceuticals was the only first-tier stock to gain on both average and closing quotes. It ended 50 lei firmer at 6,300.
Policolor was the highlight of otherwise lacklustre second-tier trading with 1.2 billion lei in turnover.
On the second tier, eight stocks had no trade and three companies were suspended pending announcement of 1996 results.
